column2: 35-44 Male  (Patient)
column9: seems to work ok . i also have to go to the ER if it my migraine's gets worse.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am only 20 years old and I have scholiosis, interstitial cystitis in my bladder which is severely painful, and I have chronic headaches. My doctor put me on this and it works wonders for my headaches and my back aches. It works for my bladder as well when it flaires up, I think it is a very good medication! Its changed my life!

column2: Terry,  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has worked for me very well, Unfortunately the Doctor I'm seeing now will notprescribe it for me. I have not found anything that's works. I get migraines often and severely, and often I think I'm going to die. I need to find a physician that would prescribe it for me.

column2: candirenee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken Fiornal #3 for almost 20 years now for my excruitating headaches. I have inflammation/damaged nerves in my neck due to a fall, and it presents like a cluster headache. It is intolerable pain. This medicine is the only one that allows me to function.  My only problem now is tolerance due to the length of time I've been on it. I've been on it daily for the last 1 1/2 years as the pain presents EVERY DAY. This medicine is different because it's effect last longer.  Even though I take it every day, I am NOT addicted...I know this because a month ago I had SEVERE HIVES, and was on Predisone for 4 days (1st time in my life I had ever taken Predisone), and Predisone KILLED my pain. I had no urge to take the Fiornal #3. Unfortunately for me, I can't take Predisone for the pain.

column2: CODEINE help, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: UNTIL THREE YEARS AGO I DID NOT KNOW THISWAS 'MAN-MADE MORPHINE.  I AM VERY ADDICTED AND I AM ASHAMED OF IT.  I DO NOT WANT TO GO IN FOR TREATMENT BECAUSE IT COST TOO MUCH BUT I WANT TO QUIT TAKING IT., EVENTHOUGH I HAVE HAD BONE REPLACEMENTS IN MY NECK FROM C1-5 AND IT HURTS 80 PERCNET OF THE TIME, I STILL WOULD LOVE TO FIND SOMETHING OTC TO HELP ME.

column2: sunniehawaii, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have Addison's Disease and I take 30mg of Adderall in the morning and 10 mg at noon and if I need it, 10mg in the evening. I have alot of anxiety because I don't produce the Hormone Cortisol. This is one of the things your Adrenal Gland gives to you automatically for stress. So I get anxious. I took my Fiorinal w/Codeine for a headach one day and realized that it gave me a sense of Calm Energy. That is the only way I can describe it. It was wonderful. It enhanced the Adderall enough for me to have more energy and not to feel anxious at all. I talked to my doctor about it and now she lets me take one in the morning and one in the afternoon. It's like I have been searching for something to help and just stumbled onto this.

column2: lisa frady, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i have taken fiorinal#3 for approx.15yrs and theryre is no other medication that will stop any type of headache i have... i thinks its wonderful!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have chronic pain from failed c5-c6 fusion and also still have pinched nerves and herniated disks in my neck. I also have moderate stenosis with encroachment on my spinal cord in my Thoracic that adds to my pain. I was given these when extra nerves in my neck got pinched. I am usually on Norco 10mg-325 which at least holds the pain at bay. When I take the Fiorinal, it works about as good as the ton of Tylenol I also take. The only upside to these are they can at least make you sleepy enough to try to fall asleep and get at least 2 hours sleep. It could be the 10mg of Valium I was also prescribed that's making me sleepy. Unless you have migraines, don't bother with these. But of course, you present with pain, you just HAVE to be faking.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication for approximately 10 years for tension headaches and chronic neck pain which contributes to the headaches.  I don't know what I would do without it.

column2: lizcbad, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with migraines for over 30 yrs. Runs in my family, my mother, her father and her sister, and now, my daughter.  I am RH negative and when my first child was born he was RH positive so I had the rhogam(sp) shot. Five years later my daughter was born RH negative - and BAM - total hormonal change.Was a guinea pig for a large pharmaceutical company that paid for my neurologist-their finding "you have migraines and there is no cure".  I have tried all of the preventative meds and none work.  Fiorinal w/codeine is the only thing that helps me function.  Doctors fight me all the way when trying to get refills - but nothing else works!  I don't know about addicting - sometimes I have to go weeks before getting a new prescription and I never have symptoms of withdrawal - only headaches and nothing to take  It is very stressful not knowing if you can get the only thing that works.  Can only get generic through my insurance.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It seems to make me anxious, and seems to increase heartrate, has not helped with headache as much as I had hoped. All in all makes me feel pretty bad

column2: charles05, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It helps with my migrane headaches but I have found that I have had to increase my dosage since the 2 every 4 hours is ineffective anymore.

column2: scully1958, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take 5-6 of these a day (along with 3 Percocet a day) to manage severe chronic neck pain that gives me headaches every day. Without this I would not be able to function. I wake up in pain and go to bed in pain. This Medication allows me to have some quality of life and allows me to get to work every day. Yes I know it is addicting, but so what. If it gives me relief, and I am under constant supervision from my doctor, then I will continue to take it. Have tried everything else, from surgery, physical therapy, accupuncture, epidural injections. Even bought a sauna for my home. Nothing helps. Can't take anti-inflammatory meds. This is the only thing (along with the Percocet) that helps alleviate my debilitating pain. I thank God for this medication(s) and for the Doctor that prescribes them for me. And do not judge me unless you have walked in my shoes and have experienced the excruciating pain that I live with.

column2: Penelope, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this med for over 10 years for hormone-induced migraines.  It has worked very well in the past.  I usually take one fiorinal with two motrin.  Now, I get rebound headaches with that so I have switched to a fiorinal with two aleve.  I hope to get past menopause and be DONE with headache meds.

column2: teacher901, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: The ONLY med that stops me from turning into a vomiting non-functioning person as a result of headaches daily. ONLY brand name works. Took 3 yrs. to find a dr. willing to prescribe it. Last I checked, 180 pills were over $700. Outrageous!

column2: rooster, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: My dr. prescribed this medicine for my migraines and it works wonders for me. Tried the preventative drugs but did not like the side effects, also Midrin which did absolutely nothing for the pain. I can take this and still function normally.

column2: mymissy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have headaches EVERY day...a lot of tension but I have migraines a regular basics. I have taken this medication for years and works very well for me. I had cervical disk surgery in 2006 and pain from that is also an every day pain. The generic does nothing at all for me...the brand name works great.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: Very Very Addictive. My mother has been having migraines for 20+ years. She has been on and off, small amt of pills, large amt of pills over the years.She tried to stop a few times and had convulsions and seizures. She has to come down in small doses because her body is used to having it in her. She still gets headaches on occasion. This is very addictive medicine, stick to the dose the tell you. please be careful if it works for great but don't overdo it!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am 47 yrs old and have had migraines since age 20. been to many neurologists over the years who have been prescribing preventive meds that just do not work. They are reluctant to give out too many but I have found that my family dr. does and it works wonders. A lot of drs. will say it is addictive but I have been taking it for 20 years (when I Have the migraine (4 or 5 a month) and without it I can go to work, function in life. Because I belive no one should suffer in pain. I have tried almost every preventive and other pain med available and it is a shame that drs. are reluctant to prescribe it.

column2: sheba, 65-74 Female
column9: It does not work very well anymore. They have taken most of the medication out of the fiorinal #3. The Generic does not help at all. It also costs $200.52 for 100 of the brand name of Watson. Shame on Watson.20 yrs ago 100 of them cost $15.00 per 100 made by (Eli Lilly) out of Canada. Codine Phosphate is a man made drug. We have a big problem with all our drugs.No wonder people go to the streets to find relief.I have Fibromyalgia and it is no picnic. New drugs make me sick. We are all ginnie pigs.Pharmacys,Doctors,&the middle man are the only one who benifit from all these new drugs. Let your voices be heard. Lets get back to the medications that work.Thank You for your time

column2: Buckshot0857, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This doesn't really knock out my migraines...rather numbs them a bit is all. It used to be more effective...maybe my body has built up a tolerance to the medication. The caffeine in the capsule keeps me up all night...so I really can't use it then.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I started having migraines as a child and began taking this medication as needed in my 20's.  Still works amazingly for me.  Every so often my dr makes me try something else, but nothing works as well..without the side effects or having to take meds every day

column9: I have been on this drug for a long time and at times have had trouble getting off this medication.

column9: I've suffered with migraines for 6 years. Finally I have something that works for my pain and allows me to work each day.

column2: wendy5001, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I have NO IDEA what to do as this has been the only thing in years to help!

column2: sandysgirls1984, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had migraines since I was 15 years old and now I am 51 years old. It has helped tremendously.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This is the only medication that I have found that consistently works for me and I carry some with me at all times. However, I have found if I have several weeks of headaches occuring 3 or more times a week, the effectiveness is greatly decreased and I must temporarily use a less effective alternative or just deal with the pain for a few days. I use the generic version which has worked well for me. Happily as I get older I seem to be needing my medication less and less.

column2: UltraMarathonGirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Have suffered from "Migraine" for 20 years... and i would be lost without Fiorinal w/Codeine. I've since added Topomax 2X a day as a preventative... but when I need to function at work, this is definitely a wonder drug. It's too bad doctors are so hesitant to prescribe it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have tried every out there for my migraines.  I started taking this medication and it stops the pain immediately.  I am so glad I was put on this med.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from migraines since I was child, I've tried almost everything to help. Fiorinal 3 immediately relieves the pain so I can go on with daily activities...

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i was in a car accident when i was 18. the end result was a torn acl and miniscus in my knee. trust me i have been on all pain meds imaginable(with a libral doctor) the combo of a barbituate and opid seems to be the perfect match for me. the only unfourtunate detail about this medication is that if one does not take it for the tension headache, it is likely to develop. however, compared to knee pain it is far less.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: Ihave tried every medication for migrame headaches and fiorinal/cxodine is the only treatment so far that has worked.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: My mother in law has been addicted to this drug for about 10 years. She feels like she needs it to live. Please think again before you take this med.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have had migraine headaches for as long as I can remember and have taken everything to try to get rid of them. My doctor prescibed fiorinal 3 and it has been a life saver. the only probelm is the size of the capsule. But this medication has worked wonders for me.

column2: Tala, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication is the most horrible I have ever experienced. My doctor originally had me on Norco 10/325, which was working for the better part, and I requested something that might work better, so he put me on this stuff. EVERY TIME I take it, I throw up violently within 30 minutes, even with food, milk, no food, etc.  It really does nothing for the headaches, and to be honest, it is barely a notch above taking nothing at all and having both the severe headaches, plus withdrawls from being on Norco for so long. I have read how much it has helped others, and I have NO idea what the difference is between me and you, other than that it causes such a violent reaction in me. Please, for anyone considering this medication, take my words of advice and look elsewhere, or at least be able to change it immediately if it does not work on you. I feel like a thousand knives are stabbing me in my gut at all times, and I barely can function at all. BE FOREWARNED!!!!!!!!

column2: Root, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had 2 herniated discs for about 15 yrs. When my normal pain meds became unavailable, 30 mg's of this stuff done nothing for my back pain. It may work for headaches, but no good for back pain. I hope it works for everyone better than it does me

column2: DJ , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Its the only pain releiver that helps me with migraine headaches

column2: RN, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: I have tried many many migraine meds over the past 2o yrs. and have not found any as effective as Fiorinal #3. I have suffered from migraines since I became preg in 1984. I am lucky that the years that I have been taking this medicine that it still works so well for me. This medicine has saved me alot of money over the years due to extra office calls and ER visits. I have found over the years that the trick is to take the medicine at the 1st sign of an attack. I occasionally have to take phenergan if the nausea hits too quick and I can't take the medication quick enough. After my hysterectomy I had severe headaches due to the hormonal treatment, which I eventually stopped. When I was on the hormones I would take them at night along with a Fiornal #3 and it would prevent the headaches.

column2: Marcy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: I had continuous headaches with no other meds that helped me the way Fiorinal 3 did.  I can function at work if I need to take the med & I have no other problems.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The most effective medication I've tried for tension headache.  Highly recommend.

column2: pixilee333@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: severe migraine headaches and Fibromyalgia

column2: pixilee333@aol.c, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I suffer with migraines daily. I also have Fibromyalgia. I find this medicine is very good for my all over pain as well in conjunction with Midrin and Compozine. I did not realize that the brand name works better than the generic. Thanks to the reviews that I read, I now know it.

column2: StreetRodLover, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: To "Jeneal" -- you are SO right regarding brand vs. generic on this medication.  The generic does NOTHING for my pain, and once when the pharmacy made a mistake and filled my Rx with generic, I found myself taking  more than the recommended amount.  In fact, I always select name brand medications and NOT the generics.  I KNOW, I KNOW that it's more expensive, but when I am sick, and taking Brand medication makes me feel better faster, I always take Brand.  I am lucky in that I have good insurance.

column2: StreetrodLover, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For years, I have suffered very severe, daily migraines which resulted in *weekly* ER visits for IV pain meds & fluids.  I've tried virtually EVERY known "migraine" med & went to every neurologist in town -- to NO avail. Fiorinal/codeine + 50mg Phenergan IM (injection) which I take for nausea, is the only thing that works for me.  Recently I also began suffering from severe fibromyalgia, plus knee & severe lower back pain stemming from an MVA that occurred more than 30 years ago. Since I cannot take most of the other pain meds, my doctor prescribed Fiorinal to treat my break-thru pain.  Although many doctors don't like to prescribe Fiorinal/codeine, this is about the ONLY pain medication I can take.  I always monitor the amount I take, and I've found that this medication works great.

column2: Jeanal, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take this medication for my headaches and lupus/arthritis pain and so for it has helped me tremendously. I am very satisfied. My only problem is that the generic brand is not as good as the name brand. It does not upset my stomach and is easy to swollow.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Taking for Cluster Headaches.  Several times a day.

column9: Have greatly reduced the number of injections of demoral needed by being able to keep this medicine on hand in order to take at first sign of a migraine.  No longer have to suffer with a headache for 3 or 4 days before being diagnosed & getting an injection for the migraine

column2: Hoover, 35-44 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Works better than other migraine meds I have tried.
